intro: Oldenlandia machingensis, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Oldenlandia machingensis is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
